Summary: large bright light. diminishes in brightness and moving north.
divs: sighting detailsi was walking with my friend down a darkened street. i was looking at the stars north northeast. suddenly a bright light appeared approximately 60 degrees above the horizon. it was a white light. very bright. much brighter than venus and about an inch or possibly inch and a quarter wide when holding my hand at arms length and "piching" it between my fingers. the light was moving north and possibly down. after 4 seconds, the light diminished greatly. it became nearly invisible to the human eye, but i was able to track it visually. it continued on it's north\downward path for two minutes before i could no longer see it. i thought it was a meteorite at first glance. i see meteorites very regularly, and i am sure this was no meteorite.
trends: There have been 30 other sightings in Boulder
There were no other sightings in Boulder on or around November 6th 2007
